intro: Siphocampylus gutierrezii, commonly known as the Gutiérrez's siphocampylus, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northwestern Mexico. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes parsley, carrots, and dill, and is characterized by its umbellate inflorescence. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in arid or semi-arid environments. It features narrow, grass-like leaves and small white or yellow flowers that bloom in summer. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
